content.raw:
I modified the script to work on Trusty. Although I'm seeing some warnings:

```
+ abi-compliance-checker -lib gazebo -old pkg.xml -new devel.xml
preparation, please wait ...
Using GCC 4.8 (x86_64-linux-gnu, target: x86_64)
WARNING: Not working properly with GCC 4.8. Please update or downgrade GCC or use a local installation by --gcc-path=PATH option.
checking header(s) branch: gazebo5_5.0.1 ...
ERROR: some errors occurred when compiling headers
ERROR: see log for details:
  /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-any_to_any-abichecker-trusty-amd64/abi_checker/logs/gazebo/branch: gazebo5_5.0.1/log.txt

checking header(s) branch: surface_friction_asserts ...
ERROR: some errors occurred when compiling headers
ERROR: see log for details:
  /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-any_to_any-abichecker-trusty-amd64/abi_checker/logs/gazebo/branch: surface_friction_asserts/log.txt

comparing ABIs ...
comparing APIs ...
creating compatibility report ...
result: INCOMPATIBLE (Binary: 0%, Source: 0.01%)
total "Binary" compatibility problems: 0, warnings: 0
total "Source" compatibility problems: 10, warnings: 0
see detailed report:
```

The testing build was the latest [on the ABI checker](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any_to_any-abichecker-trusty-amd64/138/).
